triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: The paper is inspired by and applies coordination behaviors observed in natural swarm systems to multirobot systems.

triples.name: Swarm intelligence
triples.relevance: The competitive and collaborative behaviors investigated in the paper are guided by swarm intelligence principles.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multirobot systems are fundamentally multi-agent systems with coordination and control challenges.

triples.name: Winner-take-all (computing)
triples.relevance: The paper introduces and extends the k-winner-take-all concept as the driving principle for multirobot competition.

triples.name: Recurrent neural network
triples.relevance: A recurrent neural dynamics solver is used as part of the fusion approach for distributed coordination.

triples.name: Consensus (computer science)
triples.relevance: Consensus algorithms are used to transform global information into distributed type for the coordination approach.

triples.name: Distributed computing
triples.relevance: Distributed coordination and computation are fundamental to solving the multirobot coordination problem.

triples.name: Convex optimization
triples.relevance: Optimality theory based on convex optimization is integrated into the distributed coordination approach.
